title: Kairos Ventures Raises $58 Million to Fund University Spinouts
sub_head: Venture firm invests in life sciences, physical sciences technologies
body:
Kairos Ventures, which bankrolls university scientists and invests in startups emerging from their research, said it has raised $58 million for its latest venture fund.
Los Angeles-based Kairos invests in life- and physical-sciences startups. Like many venture firms, it backs university spinouts. Unlike most venture capitalists, Kairos also provides grants, typically of $100,000 to $200,000, to academic researchers.
